intro: Indoneesiella echioides, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
